benchmark_details.name: Sarc7: Evaluating Sarcasm Detection and Generation with Seven Types and Emotion-Informed Techniques
benchmark_details.overview: Sarc7 is a benchmark for fine-grained sarcasm evaluation that operationalizes seven pragmatically defined sarcasm types: self-deprecating, brooding, deadpan, polite, obnoxious, raging, and manic, enabling nuanced understanding of sarcasm in large language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Provide a foundation for evaluating nuanced sarcasm understanding and controllable generation in language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark is limited by its reliance on textual data, lacking multimodal context essential for understanding sarcasm.

data.annotation: Manually annotated by four trained annotators using defined sarcasm types.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model predictions compared to human-annotated labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better model performance in distinguishing sarcasm types.
